fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.configurer

Annotation Type ConfigurerFor


  • @Target(value=TYPE)
 @Retention(value=RUNTIME)
 @Documented
public @interface ConfigurerFor
    Annotation to mark a Configurer instance in order to indicate which builder is targeted.

    The annotation also provides a priority that is used to order configurers in order to configure the targeted builders in right order.

    The annotation is only used by any of static builder methods:

    • MessagingBuilder.standard()
    • MessagingBuilder.minimal()

    The static methods are in charge to handle the annotation.

    Example: 

     @ConfigurerFor(targetedBuilder = "standard", priority = Integer.MAX_VALUE)
 public class MyConfigurer implements MessagingConfigurer {
        @Override
        public void configure(MessagingBuilder builder) {
                // custom configuration here
        }
 }
    The configurer MyConfigurer will be automatically registered each time MessagingBuilder.standard() is called. Its priority is the highest possible so the configure method will be called before all other configurers.
    Author:
    Aur√©lien Baudet

    • Required Element Summary

      Required Elements 
      Modifier and Type Required Element and Description
      int priority
      The configurer priority.
      String[] targetedBuilder
      The builder names that are targeted by the Configurer.

    • Optional Element Summary

      Optional Elements 
      Modifier and Type Optional Element and Description
      ConfigurationPhase phase
      The configuration phase for the configurer.

    • Element Detail

      • targetedBuilder

        public abstract String[] targetedBuilder
        The builder names that are targeted by the Configurer.

        Targetting a builder means that the configurer will be registered into the builder and then automatically applied on that builder in order to apply a particular configuration on it.

        Default builder names are:
        • minimal: see MessagingBuilder.minimal()
        • standard: see MessagingBuilder.standard()
        Returns:
        the list of builders that will be configured by the configurer

      • priority

        public abstract int priority
        The configurer priority. The priority is used to determine the orders for all the registered configurers.

        The highest priority for a configurer means that it is applied before other configurers with lower priorities.

        Default priorities are:
        • DefaultMessagingConfigurer: 100000
        • DefaultThymeleafEmailConfigurer: 90000
        • DefaultFreemarkerEmailConfigurer: 80000
        • DefaultThymeleafSmsConfigurer: 70000
        • DefaultFreemarkerSmsConfigurer: 60000
        • DefaultJavaMailConfigurer: 50000
        • DefaultCloudhopperConfigurer: 40000
        • DefaultSendGridConfigurer: 30000
        • DefaultOvhSmsConfigurer: 20000
        Returns:
        the configurer priority

      • phase

        public abstract ConfigurationPhase phase
        The configuration phase for the configurer. It indicates when the configurer should be executed.
        Returns:
        the configurer phase
        Default:
        fr.sii.ogham.core.builder.configurer.ConfigurationPhase.BEFORE_BUILD
